description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Moments in Nice" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Moments in Nice

places.generalDescription: Place Mass√©na is a charming and historic 19th-century plaza located in the heart of Nice. It is surrounded by neoclassical buildings, cafes, and upscale shops, making it a bustling city square with plenty to offer. The square hosts various public events and is connected to the pedestrian zone, providing easy access to the Old Town and seafront.

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of Nice, Place Mass√©na is a vibrant public square full of captivating scenery and magnetic energy. üí´ Colourful buildings, charming sculptures, and beautifully manicured gardens bring even more life to the area. The square was named after Jacques Mass√©na, France‚Äôs most successful military commander, who was one of Napoleon‚Äôs trusted lieutenants.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Take Photos in Nice

sources.snippet: If the Promenade des Anglais is known to be the most famous site in Nice, the  Place Mass√©na also remains a must which will seduce more than one. From your very first steps, you will be impressed by its  chic chequered floor, one of the elements that makes Mass√©na so unique. I don‚Äôt know about you but I would almost be tempted by a giant game of draughts!
sources.shortName: Top 10 instagrammable spots of Nice

sources.snippet: The last of the best photo spots in Nice, France, in terms of streets, is Place Massena. Like Place du Palais, it is also a combination of contradictory things: 19th-century buildings and modern design of facades and streets. It contains various compositions in the pop art style and figures of people from different continents.
sources.shortName: Best Photo Spots In Nice: Capture The City's Charm

sources.snippet: One iconic spot for an Instagram photo in Nice is Place Massena. It is a massive town square located in the center of the city, surrounded by red and orange buildings, and a super trippy checkered ground. The end of the plaza hosts monumental fountain with a marble statue of Apollo on top.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Places in Nice, France

sources.snippet: La  Place Mass√©na, situ√©e √† quelques pas de l‚Äô H√¥tel Florence Nice, est un v√©ritable joyau de la ville. La place est surveill√©e par le dieu  Apollon  qui tr√¥ne fi√®rement au milieu de la  Fontaine du Soleil. C‚Äôest l‚Äôendroit id√©al pour des photos hautes en couleurs.
sources.shortName: 8 meilleurs spots photos de Nice

sources.snippet: It is named after the talented marshal of the French army, Andre Massena, a friend of Napoleon. The main decoration of the square is the fountain "Sun" with beautiful bronze sculptures of ancient gods. Also on the square, there are 7 figures made of white rubber.
sources.shortName: Best places to take great photos in Nice, France

sources.snippet: Surrounded by red buildings, this plaza hosts a monumental fountain with a marble statue of Apollo on top. What makes this area recognizable is its checkerboard and super trippy ground.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagram Spots in Nice: Tips from a Local!

places.name: Place Mass√©na

reviews.text:
The Seven Statues of Massena Square (Nice, France)

Some refer to them as Buddhas, others as figures in prayer. While opinions vary-some adore them, others find them unattractive-no one remains indifferent to their presence. These seven resin statues, located in the heart of Nice at Massena Square, were crafted by Jaume Plensa, a Spanish artist renowned for his monumental works.

The statues symbolize the seven continents and the interconnectedness of diverse communities in modern society. Titled *Conversation √† Nice*, the installation embodies the idea of global dialogue. Each night, the statues are illuminated, with colors shifting gently to evoke a sense of communication and exchange between them. The effect is both visually stunning and deeply poetic.

I wandered through Place Mass√©na and loved its vibrant yet calm vibe. The checkerboard paving and lush palm trees make for a bright, welcoming space. Despite being a major crossroads, the square feels surprisingly open-with plenty of benches to sit and soak in the atmosphere. In the evening, the illuminated fountains and soft lighting create a peaceful, magical moment to pause amid the city's rhythm.

Wonderful place where people gather specially with the sun set of all walks of lives. Majority of them are tourists from all over the world
Surrounded by majestic historical buildings giving opportunities to restaurants fashion galleries bars and many more‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

places.generalDescription: Colline du Ch√¢teau, also known as Castle Hill, is a historic hilltop park in Nice that offers breathtaking views of the city and the sea. The climb up the stone steps to this hill is short but rewarding, with turquoise coasts and apricot-colored roofs spreading out before you as you ascend. From the summit, you can enjoy grand vistas of the Old Port with its yachts and sails, as well as distant views of the snow-dusted peaks of the Alps.

sources.snippet: La Colline du Ch√¢teau  est le lieu ni√ßois pr√©f√©r√© des  photographes. Plusieurs points de vue s‚Äôoffrent √† vous pour r√©aliser le meilleur clich√© :  la Baie des Anges, les toits de la Vieille-ville  et le  Port de Nice. La Colline du Ch√¢teau regorge √©galement de magnifiques recoins pour immortaliser un shooting photo d‚Äôun mariage par exemple : la cascade, les ruines du ch√¢teau, et des espaces de verdure.
sources.shortName: 8 meilleurs spots photos de Nice

sources.snippet: If you are expecting a castle, well prepare to be disappointed!. La Colline du Ch√¢teau (meaning the Castle‚Äôs Hill) is nowadays only a hill. Even if we still call it Le Ch√¢teau, this place used to be a military citadel that was destroyed under Louis XIV. It is still worth going up there though because of the breathtaking panoramic views.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagram Spots in Nice: Tips from a Local!

places.name: Colline du Ch√¢teau

reviews.text:
A free attraction in Nice and definitely setting aside a couple of hours to do during your stay. There are some amazing views and photo opportunities and the whole area has a lovely vibe, tourists and locals mixing together.

We walked up there from our hotel, The Palais S√©gurane boutique hotel on Rue Catherine S√©gurane. It started off with a gentle ramp and there various sets of steps from time to time but if you're relatively fit you'll mange it without too much problem.

We just explored the routes, essentially if you keep heading upwards you won't go far wrong. Once at the top there are several different areas, some open spaces, a couple of food stalls, a toilet (0.5 Euros), some amazing vantage points, a performance area and of course the famous waterfall.

The views out over Nice are quite astounding and it's easy to lose yourself watching the world go by in miniature beneath you. We also tried to work out where we'd been in the city.

We didn't try to use the elevator which I imagine can get busy. The walks up and down tend to spread people out and there are little diversions and resting areas.

Given the proximity to the old town it's easy to make a full day of the area.

We reached the top by cart. The road itself is beautiful, the nature and remains that we saw prepared us for the view and the pigeons, wonderful, white ones. The view of the place is fantastic, and a large part of the park is left for children and adults to enjoy freely. A great place to spend the day. The view of the waterfall, from above, leaves an unusual impression. It may take a bit of sanding, but the experience is unforgettable.

Wonderful place and totally worth the climb! Tip: go in the morning, the sun hits the hill on the other side. You will get better views and will avoid the crowds. Also, if you go in summer, it's way cooler!

places.generalDescription: Nice Cathedral, also known as Cathedrale Sainte Reparate, is a stunning Baroque cathedral located in the heart of Old Town. Built in the late 17th century on the foundations of a parish church, it features a graceful Baroque style that blends seamlessly with its surroundings. The cathedral houses paintings, three organs, and an altar containing the remains of St. Reparata.

sources.snippet: Nice Cathedral was built between 1650 and 1699 and its  Roman architecture stands in the Vieux-Nice. It is devoted to Saint Reparata, the symbol of the Baie des Anges as the young martyr was brought to the  Nice shore by angels. Snap photos of this magnificent infrastructure inspired by Saint Peter's Basilica in Rome.
sources.shortName: 8 Places To Take Photos In Nice

places.name: Cath√©drale Sainte-R√©parate de Nice

reviews.text:
Already beatifull on the outside, but the inside of the cathedral is absolutely magnificent. Really nice design with gold touches everywhere you look.
Definetly worth giving a visit.  Just infront is a small square where you can have a lunch with a magnificent view

Nestled in the city center, the Nice Cathedral is a breathtaking masterpiece of architecture. Its detailed design and calm atmosphere create a serene escape from the lively streets outside. The cathedral's magnificent exterior and impressive interior are captivating, making it a must-visit for anyone interested in history and culture. The quiet ambiance adds to the sense of peace, allowing visitors to truly appreciate its beauty and significance. An unforgettable landmark that enriches the city's charm ‚Äì highly recommended for a visit.

Cathedral design in baroque architectural style. Relic of Sainte-Reparate housed within. The interior is also decorated in the baroque style. The dome vault is huge & so is the pipe organ of the Cathedral.

My wife & I went for service there on Mother's Day. Mass Service was listed as 9am, 1030am, noon, The 1030am service started at 11am! Service was late, but the ceremony was beautiful.üòá

Worth visiting, the organ music alone made the service outstanding!üôè

places.generalDescription: Prom. des Anglais is a 7-km-long beachfront promenade in Nice, France, lined with palm trees and featuring a bike path. It has been a popular spot since the 18th century when English aristocrats sought refuge from winter weather. The promenade extends from the airport to Nice's old town and is home to many hotels and cafes. Visitors can enjoy seaside walks, known locally as 'the Prom,' while taking in the sea air and lively atmosphere of Nice.

sources.snippet: The Promenade des Anglais is a seaside promenade that stretches along the Mediterranean coast, offering beautiful city views on one side and gorgeous ocean views on the other. üòç The promenade is lined with palm trees, flowers, and benches, making it an inviting place to relax and soak up the sun. For a lovely afternoon, bring a picnic lunch to enjoy on the beach after a walk along the promenade‚Äîwith the sea breeze, ocean sounds, and azure waters, you‚Äôll make unforgettable memories here.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Take Photos in Nice

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôve seen photos of Nice before, the chances are they are from this Promenade. This 7 km (5 miles) main avenue is a gorgeous walkway along the beach. On one side you have fancy hotels and expensive housing (sea view comes with a price!) and on the other side, there is an immense pebble beach strip made into a mosaic of private and public beaches.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagram Spots in Nice: Tips from a Local!

sources.snippet: Promenade des Anglais is one of the most famous attractions not only in Nice but throughout France. This is a favorite place for many tourists and locals. The boulevard has a length of almost six kilometers and stretches along the Bay of Angels from the city airport to the port of Nice.
sources.shortName: Best places to take great photos in Nice, France

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôve ever seen photos of Nice before, chances are they are from this Promenade. This iconic main avenue is a 5 mile long gorgeous walkway right along the beach. On one side of the Promenade you can see lots of fancy hotels and expensive housing,
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Places in Nice, France

sources.snippet: A wonderful place to come and people watch at any time of year, especially in the summer months. The stunning old hotels, the deckchairs and the huge variety of people enjoying the walk make this a photographer‚Äôs dream. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Nice

sources.snippet: Nice‚Äôs coastline is one of the must-see places on the French Riviera. It is 7 kilometers long and the views along the way will leave you in awe. The azure waters will make you feel like you are visiting a tropical destination!
sources.shortName: 5 Best Photo Spots in Nice, France

sources.snippet: When it‚Äôs still raining or just afterwards, the Prom‚Äô is adorned with all sorts of reflections and becomes even more beautiful. I‚Äôve made it one of my specialities. I love puddles and reflections.
sources.shortName: The very best instagrammable photos spots in Nice

sources.snippet: The Promenade des Anglais is the most famous promenade in the world and a very popular tourist attraction. Capture the seafront and famous blue chairs at sunset. You'll be blown away!
sources.shortName: 8 Places To Take Photos In Nice

places.name: Prom. des Anglais

reviews.text: Very beautiful, scenic and lively avenue along the coast with passengers walking around in numbers even at midnight. And the avenue is exceptionally bright, of course.

A nice promenade is a peaceful and scenic place for a leisurely walk, often along the water-be it a beach, river, or lake. It's where you feel the breeze, watch people pass by, and maybe catch a sunset. It invites relaxation, conversation, and a moment to just enjoy the view.
A very nice long road with a beautiful sea view and beaches along the way on one side, and nicely colored houses on the other.

places.generalDescription: Cimiez Monastery, an 800s monastery with gardens overlooking Nice, is a historical site that offers a glimpse into the Franciscan way of life. The monastery includes a church, a 17th-century chapel, and a museum showcasing the history and development of the Franciscan order. Visitors can admire paintings by the Brea brothers in the church and explore the cemetery where artists Henri Matisse and Raoul Dufy are buried.

sources.snippet: The Monast√®re de Cimiez is an active monastery sitting atop a hill overlooking Nice. The small monastery is surrounded by amazing gardens kept up by the monks. It is a relaxing and quiet place to go to if you want to escape the busy city center.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagram Spots in Nice: Tips from a Local!

places.name: Monast√®re de Cimiez

reviews.text: A little away from the city, the monastery is a nice place to visit if you want to be surrounded by nature and enjoy some silence. It has a beautiful garden and a nice view of the city. Also can walk up there for someone who like walking, it's moderate hill and it took me less than 45min from the city.

Beautiful Monastery with very detailed frescoes, and a series of gardens, including a re-wilded one full of flowers and a more formal garden. Great place to sit and be quiet. Free entry.
The cemetary is lovely too, housing Matisse's grave, and is next door to the park, which houses the Roman arena and the Matisse museum.
We walked from here to the Chagall museum and then back to Nice.
Very enjoyable afternoon

A nice little break from the hustle and bustle of Nice.  We had a morning to explore, so we took a bus up to walk around the Cimiez Monastery and gardens.  Unfortunately we couldn't get into the church due to service, but the jardin was open and free.  Lots of roses, some great views of Nice and up the Rives du Paillon.  Would be great to come back and explore inside a little bit.  Otherwise, worth the visit.

places.address: Place Jean-Paul II Pape, 06000 Nice, France

places.generalDescription: Cath√©drale Saint-Nicolas de Nice is a stunning Russian-style Orthodox cathedral located in the heart of Nice, France. The exterior resembles Moscow with its onion domes and vibrant colors, creating a unique contrast to the surrounding French square. Inside, visitors are greeted with opulent furnishings, intricate woodwork, religious icons, ornate sculptures, and beautiful paintings. The 17th-century Baroque facade adds to the cathedral's grandeur.

sources.snippet:
La Cath√©drale Orthodoxe Saint-Nicolas de Nice  est connue pour sa magnifique  architecture atypique. La Cath√©drale a √©t√© r√©nov√©e r√©cemment, l‚Äôint√©rieur vaut √©galement le d√©tour. Adresse : Avenue Nicolas II - 06000 Nice
Horaires d‚Äôouverture : Du lundi au dimanche / de 09h00 √† 12h00 et de 14h00 √† 18h00 (du 01/04 au 31/10) de 09h30 √† 12h00 et de 14h00 √† 17h30 (du 01/11 au 31/03)
Acc√®s depuis l‚Äôh√¥tel : 18 min √† pied / 16 min en tram
sources.shortName: 8 meilleurs spots photos de Nice

places.name: Cath√©drale Saint-Nicolas de Nice

reviews.text: Nice Russian Orthodox building not far from the railway station. It has a nice green area around it, with rabbits running around. Inside is beautiful. Well worth a visit if in the area.

Found this a worthwhile visit.  ‚Ç¨5 will permit you to go to the basement of the church to view a short feature on the history of the  cathedral which makes for an interesting backdrop as you view the cathedral itself.  Beautiful and peaceful inside, and very pleasant ladies who admit you, plus a small gift shop if you are so inclined.

What a grandiose place of worship!

The church looks absolutely fabulous both from outside and majestic on the inside. Being my first visit to a Russian Orthodox church, there were so many things that were different to my eyes.

There is no longitudinal nave with bench seats. Instead this is what traditional wooden chapels would have looked like. The construction reminded me of Ottoman buildings (pardon my ignorance).  The intense gilded decor and dark shaded paintings instantly detaches you from the outer chaotic world.

Amazing experience.

places.generalDescription: Cascade de Gairaut is a charming man-made site located in the far north of Nice, France. The picturesque waterfall, rock grottoes, and Swiss-style chalet were all constructed in the late 19th century and are listed as historic monuments. Ducks have made this place their home, adding to its bucolic charm. Visitors can enjoy a tranquil escape from city life amidst the cascading waterfalls and lush hills.

sources.snippet: Ce petit coin secret perch√© dans les collines abrite un chalet en bois d‚Äôinspiration autrichienne surplombant la Cascade de Gairaut. Pensez aussi √† visiter les grottes de rocailles qui offrent une magnifique fen√™tre sur la cascade et un panorama exceptionnel. Une vue sur la ville, les collines et la mer √† travers les roches naturelles de la grotte
sources.shortName: Les 15 lieux les plus instagrammables de Nice !

sources.snippet: An ideal place to recharge your batteries along the water‚Äôs edge. And to end this little tour in beauty, I propose you to discover a  secret corner that rhymes with serenity. Perched on the  hills of Nice, the  Cascade de Gairaut  is  one of the most unusual spots in the region.
sources.shortName: Top 10 instagrammable spots of Nice

places.name: Cascade de Gairaut

reviews.text: Lovely stop off for when you visit Nice, a small drive from the centre through winding roads, it has a car park which is free to use. Was very quiet when we visited so I'd throughly recommend the trip up the views over nice are spectacular
One of the amazing place with a good hike from Nice, not so touristy as many people doesn't know about this place. Also have the city view from the top. Very calming, peaceful and refreshing.

Beautiful and impressive! A striking sight after walking there along the Canal de Gairaut (which to our disappointment was unfortunately dry) which is the nicest way to get here. Lovely place in the summer, it's literally refreshing. Too bad the guardhouse is is falling into disrepair and that one can't visit it. We took the bus back to Nice city center, the bus stop is just behind the guard house, very convenient.

places.address: Rac de la Croix, 06100 Nice, France

places.generalDescription: Port de Nice, also known as Nice Port, is a trendy and vibrant neighborhood that embodies the dolce vita of the Mediterranean. It features typical Mediterranean houses, colorful boats, antique shops, and thrift stores. The area offers convenient parking near the antique market, old Nice, and the chateau for day trips. Visitors can enjoy watching ships, ferries, and yachts coming in and out of the port while taking in the view of small pebble beaches between the port and Cap de Nice.

sources.snippet: If I had to name one part of the city that really embodies the Mediterranean feel, it would definitely have to be the Port of Nice. The port is a very trendy and vibrant neighborhood where you can find typical Mediterranean horse, colorful boats, antique shops, and thrift stores. It is ideal for fleeing the busy city center to relax while watching the ferries sail across the Mediterranean sea.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Places in Nice, France

sources.snippet: If there is a place in Nice that embodies the dolce vita, it is le Port de Nice (Nice Port). Often forgotten by travelers, this area shouldn‚Äôt be overlooked. The port is a very trendy and vibrant neighborhood where you can find typical Mediterranean houses, colorful boats, antique shops, and thrifts stores.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagram Spots in Nice: Tips from a Local!

places.name: Port de Nice

reviews.text: Great view. Nice little place.

I fall in love with the yachts parked on the port and now i want to buy one too, the only issue is that i don't have that kinda money, so may be in 10 to 15 years, you will see my yacht parked here too.
Jokes apart, it is a nice place to visit.

If you live near Port de Nice you have a chance to watch incoming and leaving ships, ferries, yachts. Good to be a bit aside as smoke from big ships spoil the air. The rest is great. Small and clean pebble beaches between port and cap de Nice are good enough for short or long stay.

places.generalDescription: March√© Aux Fleurs - Cours Saleya - Nice is a long-standing outdoor market known for its fresh flowers, local produce, and food products. Located in Nice's old quarter on the pedestrianized main street of Cours Saleya, this market operates daily except for Mondays when it transforms into a flea market.

sources.snippet: The French are obsessed with food and the market has always been at the heart of that experience. Stroll around here eating the freshest fruit, grabbing something to eat later and getting some great shots of the action is a real highlight. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Nice
10 Most Instagramable Spots in Nice, France: Photos to Inspire Your Visit

places.name: March√© Aux Fleurs - Cours Saleya - Nice

reviews.text: March√© Aux Fleurs at Cours Saleya is a vibrant and bustling market in the heart of Nice. It's got everything-from stunning flowers to unique artwork, delicious sweets, fresh produce, and more. The atmosphere is lively, and it's a fantastic spot to explore, soak in the local culture, and find unique treasures. A must-visit!

A glorious daily plunge into good flavours smells and ideas, this is a varied market of fresh produce, spices, cheeses, meat in fact everything you need for a good meal. We grazed the huge variety of salts and spice mixes as well as picking up some local cheese for lunch. Surrounded by restaurants, bars and cafes to suit all pockets and tastes, this a wonderful introduction to the life of the cote d'azur!!

If you're visiting Nice, start your Riviera food journey at the iconic Cours Saleya Flower Market. It's not your average market - it's a full sensory experience and one of the most authentic places to sample local flavors.

Wandering through the colorful stalls, we were instantly drawn in by the scent of fresh blooms and sizzling street food. We tried socca, a crispy chickpea pancake hot off the griddle - warm, slightly smoky, perfectly salted. An absolute must. Just around the corner, we discovered a sweet surprise: a tiny tart with caramelized peanuts and salted butter caramel that was honestly unforgettable.

Though it's not a sit-down restaurant, Cours Saleya is a food lover's paradise. Locals mix with visitors, the vibe is laid-back and lively, and everything feels real and rooted in the culture of the South of France. Whether you're grabbing a bite or just taking in the atmosphere, this spot is worth every minute.
